43#define QP_IMPL // this is QP implementation
44#include "qp_port.hpp" // QP port
45#include "qp_pkg.hpp" // QP package-scope interface
46#include "qsafe.h" // QP Functional Safety (FuSa) Subsystem
47#ifdef Q_SPY // QS software tracing enabled?
48 #include "qs_port.hpp" // QS port
49 #include "qs_pkg.hpp" // QS facilities for pre-defined trace records
50#else
51 #include "qs_dummy.hpp" // disable the QS software tracing
52#endif // Q_SPY
53
54#if (QF_MAX_EPOOL > 0U) // mutable events configured?
55
56// unnamed namespace for local definitions with internal linkage
57namespace {
58Q_DEFINE_THIS_MODULE("qf_dyn")

68//$define${QF::QF-dyn} vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
69namespace QP {
70namespace QF {

72//${QF::QF-dyn::poolInit} ....................................................
73void poolInit(
74 void * const poolSto,
75 std::uint_fast32_t const poolSize,
76 std::uint_fast16_t const evtSize) noexcept
77{
78 std::uint_fast8_t const poolId = priv_.maxPool_;
79
80 // see precondition{qf_dyn,200} and precondition{qf_dyn,201}
81 QF_CRIT_STAT
82 QF_CRIT_ENTRY();
83 QF_MEM_SYS();
84
85 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(200, poolId < QF_MAX_EPOOL);
86 if (poolId > 0U) {
87 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(201,
88 QF_EPOOL_EVENT_SIZE_(priv_.ePool_[poolId - 1U]) < evtSize);
89 }
90 priv_.maxPool_ = poolId + 1U; // one more pool
91
92 QF_MEM_APP();
93 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
94
95 // perform the port-dependent initialization of the event-pool
96 QF_EPOOL_INIT_(priv_.ePool_[poolId], poolSto, poolSize, evtSize);
97
98 #ifdef Q_SPY
99 // generate the object-dictionary entry for the initialized pool
100 {
101 std::uint8_t obj_name[9] = "EvtPool?";
102 obj_name[7] = static_cast<std::uint8_t>(
103 static_cast<std::uint8_t>('0')
104 + static_cast<std::uint8_t>(poolId + 1U));
105 QS::obj_dict_pre_(&priv_.ePool_[poolId],
106 reinterpret_cast<char *>(&obj_name[0]));
107 }
108 #endif // Q_SPY
109}
110
111//${QF::QF-dyn::poolGetMaxBlockSize} .........................................
112std::uint_fast16_t poolGetMaxBlockSize() noexcept {
113 return QF_EPOOL_EVENT_SIZE_(priv_.ePool_[priv_.maxPool_ - 1U]);
114}
115
116//${QF::QF-dyn::getPoolMin} ..................................................
117std::uint_fast16_t getPoolMin(std::uint_fast8_t const poolId) noexcept {
118 QF_CRIT_STAT
119 QF_CRIT_ENTRY();
120 QF_MEM_SYS();
121
122 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(400, (poolId <= QF_MAX_EPOOL)
123 && (0U < poolId) && (poolId <= priv_.maxPool_));
124
125 std::uint_fast16_t const min = static_cast<std::uint_fast16_t>(
126 priv_.ePool_[poolId - 1U].getNMin());
127
128 QF_MEM_APP();
129 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
130
131 return min;
132}
133
134//${QF::QF-dyn::newX_} .......................................................
135QEvt * newX_(
136 std::uint_fast16_t const evtSize,
137 std::uint_fast16_t const margin,
138 enum_t const sig) noexcept
139{
140 QF_CRIT_STAT
141 QF_CRIT_ENTRY();
142 QF_MEM_SYS();
143
144 // find the pool id that fits the requested event size...
145 std::uint_fast8_t poolId = 0U; // zero-based poolId initially
146 for (; poolId < priv_.maxPool_; ++poolId) {
147 if (evtSize <= QF_EPOOL_EVENT_SIZE_(priv_.ePool_[poolId])) {
148 break;
149 }
150 }
151
152 // precondition:
153 // - cannot run out of registered pools
154 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(300, poolId < priv_.maxPool_);
155
156 ++poolId; // convert to 1-based poolId
157
158 QF_MEM_APP();
159 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
160
161 // get event e (port-dependent)...
162 QEvt *e;
163 #ifdef Q_SPY
164 QF_EPOOL_GET_(priv_.ePool_[poolId - 1U], e,
165 ((margin != NO_MARGIN) ? margin : 0U),
166 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId);
167 #else
168 QF_EPOOL_GET_(priv_.ePool_[poolId - 1U], e,
169 ((margin != NO_MARGIN) ? margin : 0U), 0U);
170 #endif
171
172 if (e != nullptr) { // was e allocated correctly?
173 e->sig = static_cast<QSignal>(sig); // set the signal
174 e->refCtr_ = 0U; // initialize the reference counter to 0
175 e->evtTag_ = static_cast<std::uint8_t>(QEvt::MARKER | poolId);
176
177 QS_CRIT_ENTRY();
178 QS_MEM_SYS();
179 QS_BEGIN_PRE_(QS_QF_NEW,
180 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId)
181 QS_TIME_PRE_(); // timestamp
182 QS_EVS_PRE_(evtSize); // the size of the event
183 QS_SIG_PRE_(sig); // the signal of the event
184 QS_END_PRE_()
185 QS_MEM_APP();
186 QS_CRIT_EXIT();
187 }
188 else { // event was not allocated
189
190 QF_CRIT_ENTRY();
191 // This assertion means that the event allocation failed,
192 // and this failure cannot be tolerated. The most frequent
193 // reason is an event leak in the application.
194 Q_ASSERT_INCRIT(320, margin != NO_MARGIN);
195
196 QS_MEM_SYS();
197 QS_BEGIN_PRE_(QS_QF_NEW_ATTEMPT,
198 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId)
199 QS_TIME_PRE_(); // timestamp
200 QS_EVS_PRE_(evtSize); // the size of the event
201 QS_SIG_PRE_(sig); // the signal of the event
202 QS_END_PRE_()
203 QS_MEM_APP();
204
205 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
206 }
207
208 // the returned event e is guaranteed to be valid (not NULL)
209 // if we can't tolerate failed allocation
210 return e;
211}
212
213//${QF::QF-dyn::gc} ..........................................................
214void gc(QEvt const * const e) noexcept {
215 QF_CRIT_STAT
216 QF_CRIT_ENTRY();
217 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(402, QEvt::verify_(e));
218
219 std::uint_fast8_t const poolId = e->getPoolId_();
220
221 if (poolId != 0U) { // is it a pool event (mutable)?
222 QF_MEM_SYS();
223
224 if (e->refCtr_ > 1U) { // isn't this the last reference?
225
226 QS_BEGIN_PRE_(QS_QF_GC_ATTEMPT,
227 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId)
228 QS_TIME_PRE_(); // timestamp
229 QS_SIG_PRE_(e->sig); // the signal of the event
230 QS_2U8_PRE_(poolId, e->refCtr_); // poolId & refCtr
231 QS_END_PRE_()
232
233 QEvt_refCtr_dec_(e); // decrement the ref counter
234
235 QF_MEM_APP();
236 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
237 }
238 else { // this is the last reference to this event, recycle it
239
240 QS_BEGIN_PRE_(QS_QF_GC,
241 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId)
242 QS_TIME_PRE_(); // timestamp
243 QS_SIG_PRE_(e->sig); // the signal of the event
244 QS_2U8_PRE_(poolId, e->refCtr_); // poolId & refCtr
245 QS_END_PRE_()
246
247 // pool number must be in range
248 Q_ASSERT_INCRIT(410, (poolId <= priv_.maxPool_)
249 && (poolId <= QF_MAX_EPOOL));
250 QF_MEM_APP();
251 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
252
253 // NOTE: casting 'const' away is legit because it's a pool event
254 #ifdef Q_SPY
255 QF_EPOOL_PUT_(priv_.ePool_[poolId - 1U],
256 QF_CONST_CAST_(QEvt*, e),
257 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId);
258 #else
259 QF_EPOOL_PUT_(priv_.ePool_[poolId - 1U],
260 QF_CONST_CAST_(QEvt*, e), 0U);
261 #endif
262 }
263 }
264 else {
265 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
266 }
267}
268
269//${QF::QF-dyn::newRef_} .....................................................
270QEvt const * newRef_(
271 QEvt const * const e,
272 QEvt const * const evtRef) noexcept
273{
274 #ifdef Q_UNSAFE
275 Q_UNUSED_PAR(evtRef);
276 #endif
277
278 QF_CRIT_STAT
279 QF_CRIT_ENTRY();
280
281 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(502, QEvt::verify_(e));
282
283 std::uint_fast8_t const poolId = e->getPoolId_();
284
285 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(500, (poolId != 0U)
286 && (evtRef == nullptr));
287
288 QEvt_refCtr_inc_(e); // increments the ref counter
289
290 QS_MEM_SYS();
291 QS_BEGIN_PRE_(QS_QF_NEW_REF,
292 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId)
293 QS_TIME_PRE_(); // timestamp
294 QS_SIG_PRE_(e->sig); // the signal of the event
295 QS_2U8_PRE_(poolId, e->refCtr_); // poolId & refCtr
296 QS_END_PRE_()
297 QS_MEM_APP();
298
299 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
300
301 return e;
302}
303
304//${QF::QF-dyn::deleteRef_} ..................................................
305void deleteRef_(QEvt const * const evtRef) noexcept {
306 QEvt const * const e = evtRef;
307
308 QF_CRIT_STAT
309 QF_CRIT_ENTRY();
310 Q_REQUIRE_INCRIT(602, QEvt::verify_(e));
311
312 #ifdef Q_SPY
313 std::uint_fast8_t const poolId = e->getPoolId_();
314 #endif
315
316 QS_MEM_SYS();
317 QS_BEGIN_PRE_(QS_QF_DELETE_REF,
318 static_cast<std::uint_fast8_t>(QS_EP_ID) + poolId)
319 QS_TIME_PRE_(); // timestamp
320 QS_SIG_PRE_(e->sig); // the signal of the event
321 QS_2U8_PRE_(poolId, e->refCtr_); // poolId & refCtr
322 QS_END_PRE_()
323 QS_MEM_APP();
324
325 QF_CRIT_EXIT();
326
327 #if (QF_MAX_EPOOL > 0U)
328 gc(evtRef); // recycle the referenced event
329 #endif
330}
331
332} // namespace QF
333} // namespace QP
334//$enddef${QF::QF-dyn} ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

336#endif // (QF_MAX_EPOOL > 0U) mutable events configured
